DataElement.preferredName: Intestinal Disease or Disorder Block Portacath Placement Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator regarding information regarding any abnormal condition within the intestines as part of a personal medical history which will prevent the placement of a catheter to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Intestinal Disease or Disorder Block Portacath Placement Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information regarding any abnormal condition within the intestines that will prevent the placement of a catheter which is part of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Intestinal; of, or related to, or referring to the intestines.:Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Concepts.definition: Of, or related to, or referring to the intestines.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredName: Block Portacath Placement Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Interrupt the normal function of; hinder or prevent the progress or accomplishment of; stop from happening or developing; interfere with or prevent the reception of signals; impede the movement of.:No Value Exists:Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: Interrupt the normal function of; hinder or prevent the progress or accomplishment of; stop from happening or developing; interfere with or prevent the reception of signals; impede the movement of.
A surgical procedure to implant a subcutaneous venous access port in a central vein.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does the patient have any con
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have any condition/anomaly that would interfere with the appropriate placement of the IP catheter for study drug administration including: abdominal surgery within 4 weeks of study entry (for reasons other than IP port placement), intestinal dysfunction or suspected extensive adhesions from prior history or finding at laparoscopy?
